It is traditionally made with lemon juice, sugar, water, and often served chilled with a sprinkle of roasted cumin powder and chopped coriander leaves. The drink was historically sold on horse-drawn carts carrying soda-making equipment and reusable Codd-neck bottles, which are also known as "goli soda" in South India. Banta Soda remains popular in Delhi, Punjab, and Uttar Pradesh, while a variation called Panneer Soda, mixed with rose essence, is popular in Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh. Despite its commercial mass production in various flavors, the traditional lemon-based version continues to be a favorite in "fancy" bars and local establishments, such as those in Old Delhi and college campuses.
